Package bisq.asset

Bisq's family of abstractions representing different ("crypto") Asset types such as Coin, Token and Erc20Token, as well as concrete implementations of each, such as Bitcoin itself, altcoins like Litecoin and Ether and tokens like DaiStablecoin.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AddressValidator
    An Asset address validation function.
    Asset
    Interface representing a given ("crypto") asset in its most abstract form, having a name, eg "Bitcoin", a ticker symbol, eg "BTC", and an address validation function.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractAsset
    Abstract base class for Asset implementations.
    AddressValidationResult
    Value object representing the result of validating an Asset address.
    AssetRegistry
    Provides Stream-based access to Asset implementations registered in the META-INF/services/bisq.asset.Asset provider-configuration file.
    Base58BitcoinAddressValidator
    AddressValidator for Base58-encoded Bitcoin addresses.
    Coin
    Abstract base class for Assets with their own dedicated blockchain, such as Bitcoin itself or one of its many derivatives, competitors and alternatives, often called "altcoins", such as Litecoin, Ether, Monero and Zcash.
    DefaultAddressValidator Deprecated
    Erc20Token
    Abstract base class for Ethereum-based Tokens that implement the ERC-20 Token Standard.
    EtherAddressValidator
    Validates an Ethereum address using the regular expression on record in the ethereum/web3.js project.
    NetworkParametersAdapter
    Convenient abstract NetworkParameters base class providing no-op implementations of all methods that are not required for address validation purposes.
    RegexAddressValidator
    Validates an Asset address against a given regular expression.
    Token
    Abstract base class for Assets that do not have their own dedicated blockchain, but are rather based on or derived from another blockchain.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Coin.Network  

Package bisq.asset Description

Bisq's family of abstractions representing different ("crypto") Asset types such as Coin, Token and Erc20Token, as well as concrete implementations of each, such as Bitcoin itself, altcoins like Litecoin and Ether and tokens like DaiStablecoin.

The purpose of this package is to provide everything necessary for registering ("listing") new assets and managing / accessing those assets within, e.g. the Bisq Desktop UI.

Note that everything within this package is intentionally designed to be simple and low-level with no dependencies on any other Bisq packages or components.

Since:
0.7.0
Author:
Chris Beams
